q: we must be, because the loss of Andy Coulson 's link to ordinariness is considered to disadvantage Cameron, not just electorally, but in the sense that he will be a less complete and sympathetic politician without it. No politician can govern well, we believe, who does not understand what it is to be ordinary. But what about when an actual example of ordinariness shows his head, tells us what he thinks, allows us a glimpse, inadvertent or otherwise, into his unexamined biases and assumptions?
